required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Musculoskeletal Pain in Long-term Dizziness- Incidence, Prognosis and Measures

lead_sponsor.agency: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences

clinical_study.source: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This project is aimed at patients with dizziness believed to be due to conditions in the balance organ in the inner ear (vestibular diseases). Dizziness can be bothersome and influence postural control negatively, and can cause secondary musculoskeletal disorders. Dizziness can also result in reduced work capacity. The purpose of the project is to strengthen the knowledge base regarding symptom burden, prognosis and treatment of prolonged dizziness. The hypothesis is that musculoskeletal pain at baseline is a prognostic factor for prolonged dizziness.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients referred to an tertiary otorhinolarynglogical clinic due to dizziness will be invited to participate in the study. The aims are to examine the prevalence, extent and distribution of musculoskeletal pain in patients with prolonged dizziness, and to investigate the associations between musculoskeletal pain, dizziness symptoms, psychological and physical function and health-related quality of life.
Furthermore, the aim is to monitor the natural course of the dizziness symptoms and functional status in these patients, and examine risk factors for prolonged disability after 6 and 12 months. The hypothesis is that muscle pain and distress at baseline may be independently associated with prolonged complaints at follow-up.
Finally, patients who still are dizzy and have pain after 12 months will be invited to participate in one of two group interventions a) modified vestibular rehabilitation and b) virtual reality / exergaming. The interventions will be feasibility studies with a pre-post design.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: After 1 year participants who still have dizziness complaints will be offered one of two interventions: Group-based vestibular rehabilitation combining cognitive intervention, vestiular exercises and body awareness therapy Exergaming intervention with virtual reality exercises using data games and videos, and other balance exercises.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 26 weeks, 1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
primary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in dizziness handicap

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 26 weeks, 1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in musculoskeletal pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 26 weeks, 1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in vertigo symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: RAND-12 health related quality of life. 0-60 (high score better)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in health related quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. 0-42 (high score worst)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in anxiety and depression symptoms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 26 weeks, 1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change in catastrophising thoughts about the dizziness

secondary_outcome.measure: Posturography. Body sway while standing on a force platform.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change after intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Four tests of Body flexibility derived from the Global Physiotherapy Examination- 52
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change after intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change after intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,1 year, through study completion, an average 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline status and change after intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vestibular exercises combined with cognitive therapy
arm_group.description: The intervention is in groups of 8-10 patients. The interventions consists of cognitive therapy, vestibular exercises and body awareness therapy, 8 group sessions
The intervention is individual and consist of non-immersive virtual reality exercises to improve balance

intervention.intervention_name: Vestibular exercises combined with body awareness exercises and cognitive therapy
intervention.description: The intervention is group based and is a combination of information/education, vestibular exercises (head movements and gaze stability exercises) body awareness exercises and cognitive therapy
intervention.arm_group_label: Vestibular exercises combined with cognitive therapy

intervention.description: The intervention consists of different balance exercises using non-immersive virtual reality

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients referred to an otorhinolaryngological university clinic due to suspected vestibular disorders (dizziness)
- Patients must be bothered with dizziness at the time of consultation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients uable to fill in questionnaires due language barriers
- Patients not able to undergo diagnostic and testing procedures
- Patients with vestibular Schwannoma
- Patients with diving-related inner ear injuries

overall_official.affiliation: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences
